Reviews.Title: “caravel hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertas55
Reviews.Content: C. Colombo street is very noisy. Traffic is massive. But despite that when windows are closed - there are no noise in room. air conditioning works really great. Breakfast - good, u can choose from cerial, sandwiches, yougurt, milk, cake, juice, coffe, tea, water etc. Hotel a bit old fashioned. also only one lift (for 8 floor hotel), ~1.5km to metro. These are bad points.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: SAF8
Reviews.Content: My sister an i arrived on Christmas Day, we were a bit early and as always the room would only be ready at 14H00, The receptionist on duty was not very friendly, in fact the only receptionist who was friendly and very helpful was one we woke up at 3AM to open the door for us after we had got horribly lost. Two of our friends joined a day later - we had booked a triple share room and asked for a 4th bed to be put in our room (the staff were gladly able to assist) The room itself was very basic; we traveled in winter so the room was very cold (heating only went on after 5. Another issue i had was the shower, Water was not very warm at all in fact luke warm, when we enquired we were told its as hot as it gets. The walls are paper thin and you can hear the staff as early as 5 starting breakfast or cleaning up. Breakfast is very basic as well, but sufficient. The hotel is not very central however there is a bus stop just a few steps away from the door and metro (Garbatella on the blue line) just a little further up the road, so getting to the Historical City centre isnt a hassle. Should you need a cab, it should cost you about 14euro, double for a return journey. Overall its not too bad but not great either. If yoiu're on a strict budget, stay here. If you’re planning a trip to Italy and planning on spending a minimal amount of time in the Hotel then stay here. If you want to spoil yourself, don’t bother.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: Jools3137
Reviews.Content: If you are happy with a basic hotel, then this may suit you. Rooms are adequate but dated - noise from other rooms invades. Minibar empty apart from two small bottles of mineral water. Bathroom supplies minimal. Breakfast is fairly ordinary. Located out of the main tourist area, you have to bus into the city (can be complicated at the Rome end) or walk 10 mins to the Metro (trains are good). Limited restaurants to choose from - one near the hotel is ok but staff less than enthusiastic. Desk staff at hotel unhelpful, rude and show little interest in assisting your stay. I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “do not go there”
Reviews.Author: babe32
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome for 3 days.. The location of the hotel is not great, it is quite far from the metro station, and the bus service in Rome is complicated. Besides this, the personel from the hotel is steeling youre clothes and personal things. The lady who came into our room to clean, stoled a pair of pants and a pack of cigarets, later on I asked a lady who was working there, and she said that this is not for the first time that it has happend, that it is was a very comune situation. They did not give any kind of compensation, more than that, they were looking at us like some kind of trouble makers. FOR SURE I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO CARAVEL AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for visiting Rome, I will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Vasai
Reviews.Content: I liked very much that Hotel. It has a very good location, 10 minutes from the metro station Garbatella from where you can go in all the places. The breakfast was delicious, we also had a mini-fridge with 2 bottles of mineral water wich were exactly what we needed when we used to arrive at 11 pm in the room. There is also a supermarket near this Hotel. A very nice and polite girl cleaned our room every morning and we were very happy with that. In the room there were very beautiful pictures with views of the city of Rome. I will definitely stay again there and I hope the conditions will remain the same. Thank you for everything ! The Christmas in Rome was a dream and it came true !

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: sofia_psm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic, clean and the breakfast is good. The location in me opinion is ok, because is in a quiet neighborhood, and not to far from the historical center.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: rrocca1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and meet our needs but off the beaten path. Had to take buses to center every day to sightsee which wasted a lot of time. Most of the buses were easy to figure out except the one to the vatican. We ended up riding around for 2 hours because we got on the wrong bus or needed to get a transfer after the first bus which the hotel neglected to tell us, I'm not sure which one. Would recommend this hotel if you don't mind taking the bus every day to get into the city, otherwise pick one closer to the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the traveller needs”
Reviews.Author: Sisteranne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Ciampino airport, and took the Terravision bus to theTermini(cost 4 euros).Because we did not know how far away the hotel was , we took a taxi , which cost 35 euros for a twenty minute ride.The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.The room was a good size( see photos) , with an ensuite shower/toilet.A nice touch was the complimentary bottles of water in the fridge!Breakfast was a buffet continental style - plenty of coffee, cereals , breads, meats,cheese, yogurts,water , juices,fresh fruit,jams, spreads..... The hotel was very clean - we got fresh towels every morning, and sheets changed every second day..As other travellers have stated- the Metro station was a fifteen minute walk away , although there was a bus stop outside the hotel which took you to the termini in about twenty five minutes( depending on how mental the roads were!). I would definitely go back here , but not bother with the taxi ride this time!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good location for the sights buses easy once you know how”
Reviews.Author: vampyerlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel caravel in a family room 3 adults 1 teenager we were surprised to find that the room could easily hold a double and 2 single beds wardrobe and fridge with plenty of room to move around. The bath room was also a good size only complaint was the shower was attached to the bath not wall so had to hold it and the place could get very wet. Breakfast was good cereals, fruit, pastries rolls staff constantly refilling. The metro is a 10-15 walk at the top of the road turn left out of the hotel then left again then keep walking till you come to the top and turn left links to all sights. The bus stop is across the road from the hotel 714 to termini station where you can also get the metro to sights the no 30express takes you to the Vatican get off just after you cross the bridge with the statues. The tickets for the bus can only be bought from the tabbacci turn left out of hotel and left at the next street cross the road to the group of shops and take the first street and follow the “big” T signs or at the metro station 1,3 and 7days tickets can be used on metro and bus. There are 2 restaurants at the hotel we ate in the one to the right of the hotel and also got the best takeaway pizza from them. We booked our Vatican and Colosseum tours through Dark Rome they made the holiday very informative interactive and above all fun In all a basic but good hotel in an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Good If you don't mind walking!”
Reviews.Author: Luke1152
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay in Rome at Hotel Caravel in July 2010. Our stay at this hotel was booked well in advance, thus affording us a reasonable rate for an extended stay in Rome, but I would imagine the hotel's location contributes heavily to this as it is a fair walk from the city centre. The room we stayed in was small and basic, but clean and reasonably comfortable at the same time. The bathroom could have done with a little redecoration and at first it seemed as though a funny smell was coming from the air conditioner, but we may have been suffering the effects of a long days travelling and after a night’s sleep, we became more accustomed to our room, although it certainly would not have hurt to have at least one extra pillow in the room, but this all depends on personal preference. The walls are a bit thin too....I think the room next to us were jumping on the bed at 3am or something.... A MAJOR plus point for this room was that we were given a complimentary fridge and safe, which, when travelling on a student budget, certainly eases financial pressures. There is a large supermarket behind this hotel, where we were able to purchase fruit, sandwich fillings and other items which helped save on the often over priced food in central Rome. Our booking included breakfast, which was a cold buffet consisting of breads, cheese, sliced meat, cereals and fruit juices. A little disappointing was the fact that there was no variation in the breakfast menu on different days, but, for the money we paid, this was certainly sufficient. For a nice meal without the central Rome price tag, try the V. Hugo restaurant just a few doors down from this hotel. Definitely worth a try! As a side note, the internet in the hotel was extremely slow! As the title of this review would suggest, be prepared for a bit of a walk to reach anything as the local area leaves much to be desired for tourist attractions. We happen to enjoy walking, and even one day walked from the hotel to central Rome, taking about 45 minutes. The nearest metro station is "Garbatella", which is at least 10 minutes walk away. You can take a bus to the top of the street but these were not as frequent as I would have liked, so most of the time we walked to the metro station. However, once at Garbatella, you can be in central Rome in less than 5 minutes. Also, be aware that the metro trains do not run as late as in other major cities, so if you are planning to stay out until after 1am, be prepared to either walk (or stumble...depending on your choice of night out) or pay at least 20 Euros for a taxi. If you are less able to walk distances or travelling with someone who is unable to do so, you should perhaps consider a more central hotel. Some general tips that we think may be helpful to anyone visiting Rome on a budget: If you are staying for more than 3 days, consider a Week-long metro ticket. This can be used on metro trains and buses, though not the "hop on hop off" tour buses that operate in the city centre, and cost just 8 Euros each. BE EXTREMELY CAREFUL OF BEGGARS/THIEVES etc etc: I actually caught one woman with her fingers in my pocket in Termini station and consider myself very lucky that she did not manage to steal anything. Learn some basic Italian. Whilst the hotel staff and some waiters in Rome were good at communicating in English, most other Romans are not as proficient as you may think, so learning some basic phrases or even just words will aid you greatly. Fountains! Rome is full of fountains, which provided us with relief from the 40 Degree temperatures. We always carried a bottle or two of water and refilled every hour or so. Not only does this stop dehydration in such temperatures, it will also save you a lot of cash as many shops sell a normal bottle of coke for as much as 3.50 Euros! If you are eating in central Rome on a budget, consider the side streets around many of the main attractions. Prices can be reduced as much as 50% and the quality if often just as good. Taxis in Rome charge by time spent in the vehicle, so consider public transport if you need to travel during peak times In all, we would certainly stay here again for an extended stay, but in all honesty, Rome is not a big city and the majority of sites can be seen in 4 days or less, so if you are not constrained by budget, a more central hotel may be better suited to you. If however, like us, you are trying to be cost effective and don't mind a bit of a walk, then this hotel would be perfect for your needs!

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Normita92
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very bad located. Far away of everything.....and the bus service in Rome is complicated because of the traffic. So we wasted a lot of time in the buses trying to get to the downtown instead of have fun and actually known the spectacular city of Rome. Besides the receptionist were not nice...... always mad at everything...... And the hotel is old and the rooms not so clean..... I would not get back to this hotel......

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: MarouGreece
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Caravel a very nice and convenient hotel. Roos were spacious and clean, although the bathroom was old and not very comfortable. Our room was at the backyard, so there was no noise!! The breakfast was good, although I did not like the coffee (my opinion) and I would like more things in the boufet!! Another, negative was that there was no mini bar at the whole Hotel!!! The staff was very helpfull and very polite. Outside the hotel, about 5 min walk, there was a bus station were you could go to the city centre of Rome in 15-20 minutes. The distance between the airport and the hotel is about 40-50 minutes and it is very easy to find your way and, of course you do not have to take a taxi (taxi at Rome are very expensive). I would definately recommend this hotel even though it is not near centre!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abdelhadi
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a very nice area, rooms are very clean and spacious, equiped with a fridge, the staff are very nice and helpful, breakfast is very good, close to bus station and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel, NOT recommended if you want to have some rest”
Reviews.Author: Andreea_P2009
Reviews.Content: 1). Noisy hotel - The hotel has very thin walls so everything can be heard from outside and from the other rooms. Basically you will have very few hours of silence between maybe 12.00 am and 8.00 am - as of 8.30 am the cleaning starts and they do not care about customers anymore (the move beds, the use the very noisy vacuum clear, etc) - so very, very noisy hotel. 2). Ugly rooms - The rooms are old, old. Old furniture, ugly bathroom. 3). Poor breakfast - same menu everyday - 1 type of cheese, 1 type of salami, 1 type of bacon. Some cereals, and some sweets. That all - for us 1 week the same stuff was too much! 4). Location - 20 min from the city center with bus 160 (that passes very rarely) and buses 30, 130. Metro station was 15 min walk distance. To go to Termini central station you have to take bus 715 - aprox. 20 min. I would advise not to choose it.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was a cheap price and i can now see why”
Reviews.Author: lozz13
Reviews.Content: The first indication that this hotel was no good was in the taxi on the way to the hotel when the driver said I must have paid a very cheap price to book here...When i arrived i was somewhat worried about the location. There is absolutely nothing around the area still open, everything has been shut down and there was hardly another person on the street. I decided to go for a walk and found one other person who I asked about the area and why everything was shut down. They told me in the little english that they spoke that it wasn't a good area. The hotel itself was very basic, clean enough but i would not ever stay there again. The staff were ok to me but I did hear them speaking to an old man who i must say was being very difficult and unreasonable but the staff were very rude to him and even laughed at him while he was talking to them.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: heiagamvik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I - an adult couple - stayed at the Caravel Hotel for three nights during the week-end Bruce Springsteen held his concert in Rome, 19th July 2009. We found it quite all right to stay there. The nearest metro was a bit too far, but there were many bus lines constantly passing nearby (30, 130, 714, 715), ending up at Ostiense or Termini station. Breakfast was good, with enough food, though not very many choices; I missed eggs and bacon, and there were only white bread. The room was air conditioned, nice and clean, towels were changed every day. The staff, except from one uneatable female employee at the reception desk (just ask me, I remember her name), was polite. I could have wished the internet machine in the reception to be free for guests. And it would be nice if there had been been possibilites to boil water for coffee or tea at our room. But all in all, I do not have a problem by recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basically Fine”
Reviews.Author: jostryjewski
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nites. It was adequet. Which is fine with us because we only sleep here. The location was good, we caught the bus about a 100 yards away and it took us just about anywhere we wanted. Take the 714 to Termini Station or the 30 express goes to the Vatican. Don't expect the bus drivers to answer any questions. They act dumb and won't help at all. We took the 714 to Termini and caught the hop on hop off the first day and then after that we kinda had an idea where we were going when we took the 30 express. I would like to give you a couple tips on staying here. First, you sometimes have to let the hot water run for awile before it actually gets hot, but not all the time. Tickets for the bus have to be bought down the street and around the corner at a tobacco shop, no matter what the hotel people say. The air conditioner worked great, we were totally in 4 different rooms with 2 different couples and never had any issues. The hotel staff is the biggest minus to this hotel. They seem to know very little about the area immediately around the hotel. Would you believe in Rome where there are over 1000 Catholic Churches that they did not know where the nearest Catholic Church was located?? There was a little restaurant just south of the Hotel towards the old Roman Sistern, it was very good. We ate there 4 out of the 5 nites we were there. Very nice people and after the second night we became regulars and they really took good care of us.The Breakfast was good at the hotel also. I would stay there again because you get away from the hustle of the City Center. There is a grocery store behind the Hotel but you have to walk around the block because no one knows how to get there from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Satisfactory Service”
Reviews.Author: Sri_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Caravel as a part of a Cosmos tour to Italy & Greece. Overall its a decent pick for the location and proximity to the Colosseum and (25 minutes away by bus) Pantheon, Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. Expect this hotel to be somewhat like a Days Inn or Howard Johnson. Go here if you are on a budget and are looking to crash for a few nights and stay out most of the day. Our rooms were relatively clean and the breakfast buffet was not too bad. The negatives are - Out dated room from the 80's, hotel staff who did not help when asked for directions and noise from the road outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic room and amenities - but good location”
Reviews.Author: busorap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first leg of our Cosmos tour to Rome. The room was extremely tiny and very basic. The room wasn't the cleanest or the most comfortable, just very basic. There was quite a bit of noise from our neighbours. Sadly, the lady in the reception wasn't so helpful in helping us find our way around Rome, so we mostly relied on our guide book. That said, the hotel is just a 10 min bus ride from central Rome, where all the touristi-stuff is, so the location was great. Also, the continental breakfast at this hotel was pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel at a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: brahmasmi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel whilst sightseeing Rome. Though located about 30 minutes' drive from the city centre (rail terminus -The Termini), it is well connected to it by bus, metro and taxi. The Catacombs, a minor tourist attraction is within walking distance of the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has internet facility for a small price. Our room and bath were spacious and clean. Breakfast was good standard fare: choice of juices, cereals, bread, croissants, cake, ham, salami, tea and coffee. One can buy a 5-Euro telephone card from a shop nearby, which gives about 200 minutes of talk time with USA, using the hotel phone at no other charge. I could connect my camera battery charger and cell phone charger (both bought in India and suitable for use in India) to the room sockets without any problem. There's a nice cafe and an Italian restaurant next door which serve Italian meals at reasonable price ( ~ 10-12 Euro for main dish).

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere- TOTAL DUMP!!! Would not take my shoes off here!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlegirl1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caravel as part of a Cosmos tour last month. I can sleep just about anywhere, even inside a car, but this hotel gave me the CREEPS!!!! The lobby looks descent but I felt as if I was transformed back to an apartment I lived in in the Czech Republic 15 years ago! Musty, old smell,constant noise from traffic, thin, flimsy bedsheets & towels.I would not take my slipper off in the bathtub when I bathed! Room is larger compared to other European rooms & it did have a private bath, but for the price I have seen on other sites for this hotel, I would say just cough up the extra 20 Euros & stay closer to the city center. The only advantage this hotel had is that the Appian Way is about a kilometer from this hotel, other than that, STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crawcrook
Reviews.Content: The easiest way to get her is to take the train from Leonardo airport to Ostensia station 5.5 eurofrom there it is a 10 minute walk or you can catch the 715 bus from out side the station. This bus also takes you into central Rome (Teatro Marcello) from the other side of the road from the hotel. The hotel itself is what you would expect from a good three star. It is very clen with the sheets changed every day. The staff are attentive and helpfull and the well stocked buffet breakfast is more than adequate. The road outside is very noisy and busy but we could not hear it from our room but if it was the middle of summer and you had your window open it would be a different matter. There are several eateries nearby mostly of a good standard and half the price of what you will pay in central Rome. The hotel ia about 30 to 40 minutes walk from the Colloseum and overall I found it to be good value for money. My only criticism would be that you have no chance of lying in in the morning as lack of carpets means that once everybody starts moving around you are more than aware. Why do the people in the room above slways start moving the furniture about at 7.00am?

Reviews.Title: “OK - Not Bad Value”
Reviews.Author: AJWelshGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caravel on 14 - 16 March. Hotel was clean and tidy. Not in the city centre, but only 10 minute walk from Metro and then a 10 minute metro journey. Bus stop just a few minutes away. Plumbing was noisy as were some of the other guests (on the Saturday night). Hotel is on a busy street with lots of traffic - although we were not facing the road and it wasn't too bad. Continental breakfast was very good. Alcohol prices not bad for hotel, but barman did try to over-charge us and was seen doing the same to another customer - so check bills! All in all, this hotel just about did the trick for our purpose (rugby Italy v Wales) for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: breezy64
Reviews.Content: a very enjoyable stay, room was clean and tidy and linen changed every day, staff were polite and would deal with any enquries as best they could. Hotel is not city center location but is only a 10 minute bus journey to the the major sights

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but noisy and keep an eye on your belongings...”
Reviews.Author: RotherRiz
Reviews.Content: I would love to say that everything had been perfect because it very nearly was, we had four separate beds in our room, the bar man was exraordinarily helpful and did his utmost to provide food for my picky eaters on the Sunday evening of our stay... the room was clean and comfortable although basic ... the 10 min bus ride to the sights was easy and gave us all a chance to leave the busy days behind and chill for a while...alas the last night let the hotel and their staff down! A watch which was by that time a five day old christmas present went missing from the room...along with a few euros which had been left in a drawer... the evening was further spoiled by a rowdy bunch of 12 young Italians who despite several knocks on the wall and staff calls refused to behave appropriately and brought the tradition of 'Roman Orgies' so often quoted as being part of ancient Rome's colourful history back to life in the room next door to ours... this was not good when in the company of two children who could hear everything!! and we all needed to be up for an early flight the next day! Although there were many complaints through the night from us and other guests about the noise the party continued until silly o clock in the morning which was unacceptable and we were told at one point during the night to go and sort them out ourselves by the receptionist!! Hopefully the hotel will review their group bookings to ensure such issues are avoided in the future. I have given an overall rating of 3 because I am hopeful the incidents were isolated and I want to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt....but beware. Incidentally Rome was very average compared to other European cities as many of the best sites are stuck between busy roads and back streeets full of bins and grafitti... but Vatican City was extraordinarily 'moving' despite the crowds and I would love to go again, but that would probably be as part of a cruise stop soI would not need to stay in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday, not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: RLFlower
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a week in Rome and really enjoyed our time there. The Caravel hotel was fine, the bus stop is very close and tickets are sold at the reception; we did find it a bit hard to get a bus back from the city centre later in the evenings (past 10:30). The hotel was clean and I was surprised by how large the room was. The bed was pretty hard, not all that comfortable. It was useful to have a fridge and safe in the room. Even though we were on the top floor of the hotel and towards the back, the noise from the traffic was bad, plus you could hear people moving around in their rooms etc - obviously not very soundproof! There was a huge balcony too, but no table or chairs out there and some rubbish (left by previous guests) went untidied - not much of a view anyway. We found the staff friendly enough and the hotel is not bad, but if we visit Rome again we may aim to stay somewhere a little more central.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay on a Sunday”
Reviews.Author: ncypruslover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days as part of an Archers Tour,The hotel is very basic at best.The rooms were quite small and needed updating,especially the bathrooms.We were kept awake by the plumbing noises from other rooms. The beds were quite comfortable and the included breakfast was adequate. The worst thing about the Hotel for us was the location.It was in the commercial part of Rome,a bus ride away from the centre.We were unfortunately there on a Sunday and everything around was closed.It was quite a walk to find somewhere to eat or drink. To be fair,on the other 2 days we were there .We found a very nice restaurant and bar a couple of doors down from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Distant but nice”
Reviews.Author: Sunawala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and neat with cheap internet available. Rooms are spacious and the complimentary breakfast is nice. But the hotel a pretty faraway from the main attractions so I would only recommend this hotel if you have your own transport or if you really know how to use Rome's rather complicated public transport system --- you need to catch a bus to get to the hotel or swap between tram and bus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value :)”
Reviews.Author: xxMattxx
Reviews.Content: Me and My GF stayed in this hotel in August 2008. We found it to be a pleasant Experience. The staff were polite and helpful, also spoke good English Breakfast was always nice and lots of choice, eg cereals, yogurts, fruit, bread, cheeses, hams, croisants etc The rooms were fairly standard but very clean, they came with a safe, and a fridge which we used for our own food from super market in town. The hotel was situated in the south or Rome but if you cross the road you can catch buses to: 30 - Vatican (15-20) mins 715- went to venice square - colluseum (10-15 mins) 714- to town (10-15mins) bus costs 1 euro. u can buy them on the bus or before u board at the hotel. we managed to spend very little on buses because of the Italian bus system.. much cheaper and better than ours (even if they do drive like theyre in dodgems lol) To get the to hotel is quite easy. we flew to ciampino airport (sp?) and caught a shuttle bus to town (5 euros) and then the 714 to the hotel. (ask the driver for columbus-thats the area) its much cheaper than a taxi and really easy to do. I would reccomend this hotel for anyone traveling on a budget :)

Reviews.Title: “Caravel...”
Reviews.Author: RomaUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Caravel, was very clean and tidy, rooms cleaned and beds made/fresh towels on a daily basis. Staff friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast was nice. Hairdryers in rooms were rubbish though! Bus stop down the road taking you to all major attractions, although there wasnt much to do in the local area everything closed quite early. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hasdrubal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caravel for 3 nights as part of a Cosmos tour. As a budget hotel it was fine. The rooms were large and clean. It was difficult to use the shower in the bath as there was nothing on the wall to attach it to. Breakfasts were good. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The bar only opens at 3.00pm and before then no food or drinks are available in the hotel It was really easy to get into Rome by bus. You can buy tickets from the desk (1 Euro per journey). The snack bar next door was very cheap. We did go into town on Easter Sunday but because of the extremely heavy rain had to return early when we found that the snack bar and restaurants were all closed so our Easter lunch comprised an ice cream from one shop and a takeaway pizza from another. Really cheap but not what we expected!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: czechoslovakia
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. So good, its the second time i`ve stayed here. Highly recommended to anyone who wants to stay in Rome and not pay through the nose for hotels. The bedrooms are large, with individual air-con, mini-bar, wardrobe, writing table, chest of draws and large screen TV. The bathrooms are enormous. Bigger than several hotel bedrooms i`ve stayed in. They only have baths though, so if you prefer a shower, you`ll have to do it sitting down or be prepared to mop the floor! Breakfast is typical italian hotel buffet with meats, cheeses, yoghurts, fruit, cakes and juices etc. Just don`t go 10 minutes before the end as there will be a limited choice! For 50 Euros per room a night you simply cant go wrong. Very easy to get to too. Take the slow train to Roma Ostiense and then bus 30/130/60 3 stops to the hotels door. Travelling to the city centre takes 14 minutes by bus (1 Euro) and they are every few minutes till midnight. If I had to make a negative comment i would say that being on the main road into Rome its possible to notice the odd "girl" standing by the roadside if you go back to the hotel after 11pm, but they are no problem whatsoever. But this is typical of any hotel on a main road leading into any Italian city. In summary, if you dont mind a 14 minutes bus trip twice a day, save youreself a fortune and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Could not stay”
Reviews.Author: RABLancashire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last November for a stay of 7 nights from 7th May through alpharooms.com. On arrival we were told that we could not stay and were directed to Hotel Bled. Although the same grade it was very shabby and the room allocated had no waste plug for the washbasin and no hot water. We eventually managed to get the manager to transfer us to Hotel Torino. This was a vast improvement.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: streakie
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed in the hotel for three nights in january, at this time alot of renevation work was going on and the reception wasn't much to look at, the rooms were very plain, but the beds were comfortable and the room was clean, we had a shower that had the effectiveness of a tap, but it did the job in the end. the breakfast was not a very nice experience, but there was enough edible food there to fill a hole for the morning. The hotel was about 30-45 minutes walk from the coloseum, which we did on two days, however the 714 bus which passes outside the hotel and stops at the bus stop about 5 minutes away will take you to the termini and from there you can get a bus to any area of the city. My biggest advice is to get a bus ticket before you get on the bus, these can be brought at the hotel reception, or at tobaconists, otherwise you might find yourself getting a hefty fine. overall we had a pleasant stay and the hotel provided all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: happyhippos
Reviews.Content: went here with my mom in november,i liked the location,plenty of shops on the way to the metro station,bus stop right across the road to get to termini,number 714.,and a handy supermarket behind the hotel to get your bits,breakfast was mediocre,no hot food at all just cereal and pastries and a loaf which u had to slice yourself,watch those fingers! room was clean and adequate for the price paid.staff were okay,though my mom got annoyed with the waiter at breakfast because he offered every customer a cappucino and ignored her. i didnt see any ladies as mentioned in other reviews,maybe its too cold.but we had a good laugh watching two heavily graffitied dump trucks with daisies sprayed all over come to empty the bins at night under our hotel balcony. overall i would stay here again because of the convenient location and budget price.

Reviews.Title: “cheap no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: sadieloo
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the caravell in November 2006. It is a cheap no frills hotel. We booked two rooms. Both rooms were clean and had comfortable beds. Breakfast was adequate for our purpose. It is in a commercial area of Rome and there is little to see from the balconey. Unlike a previous reviewer, we saw no sign of a red light area. Perhaps it was too cold in the evening. the hotel is outside the central area of Rome. It takes about 20 minutes by bus to the centre. The bus system in rome is quite cheap and efficient. The Hotel had a map and details of the bus service in the Lobby. We sometimes took a taxi back from the centre. Usually avout 10/11 euro's. Make sure you get an offical metered Taxi. We got into an unofficial one when we arrived and were overcharged. The underground is Garabatelli and is about 20 mins walk. few places to eat nearby but a sandwich shop/diner nest door. Supermarket in the street behind the hotel sells beer etc.definately a budget hotel but it served our purpose. We spent most of the time walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Caravel - Doubt I will be back”
Reviews.Author: pompeyflyer
Reviews.Content: You do get what you pay for. The hotel was clean and the breakfast adequate. Just continental but as much as you like. It is situated on a major road into the city so can be very noisy and there is an interesting view across the road in the evening of the 'ladies of the night' but it didn't cause us any problems. We were able to walk to the Colloseum in about half an hour and the average taxi cost us between 15 - 20 euros. The area doesn't offer much in the way of restaurants. We went to the one 20 yards from the hotel and it was passable but nothing to write home about. When you do eat out look for the hidden extras. Service charges etc. The hotel bar is expensive but there is a small sandwich shop next to the hotel where you can get water, can drinks etc very cheap. There is a safe in your room which is just as well because we came back to our room late one afternoon to find it propped open with a broom! One can only assume the cleaner was coming back with something but had forgotten about it. The reception staff are miserable especially the women. We made it our mission to try and make one particular one smile. We succeeded only once! Overall it was ok for what we paid and I really didn't expect any more that we got. Would I go back? Probably not. I think I would look to pay a bit more for a better Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much for the price.....”
Reviews.Author: jrodrig
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Our visit don´t had any complication. Room big enought, very clean, comfortable, with air conditioned, strong box and TV with all countries channels, nothing to see in the window. Old bathroom with bathtub very clean too, just fine, nothing else. The stuff is nice and friendly. They help you to make your visit to Rome more enjoyable. You can buy bus/metro tickets in the hotel. The Caravel is not very well located. Is far for the centre but is well communicated. There are bus stop to centre (20min) and Termini (40min) in front of the hotel, but i don`t recommend it, ROME TRAFFIC IS HORRIBLE. If you walk 20 min from hotel you can take metro to centre (10min). Safe zone to walk, residential but not nice. HORRIBLE breakfast too. There is a restaturant next to hotel, much better but not expensive. As i said, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just would like to say that i have never stayed in such a dump! The first day we moved rooms twice coz the first room was rotten, there was mold in the fridge, someones toe nail clippings on the balcony, the toilet didnt flush, our view was of a brick wall, need i go on? The lift was dark and dingy! We tried to get some information from reception it was a struggle as they were unwilling to help! It was only the fact that we walked to the collesum station and they explained to us how to use the train and travel about without having to get cabs everywhere! W hen we looked out onto the balcony we realised we were in the middle of a red light district! You have to walk for about 10 - 15 minutes before you reach any shops so if you run of of anything like water you would have a long walk before you reached anything! Everything is closed on a sunday, if you book a taxi through the hotel they charge you extra but if you hail one from the street is cheaper! The TV in the room says it has sky but the only channel that is english speaking is CNN and not everybody wants to watch the news when your holiday! Also England where playing in the world cup but there is nowhere around to watch the match you would have to go into town and try and find somewhere! There was a nest of peigons behind our airconditioning unit on the balcony. The only thing i can say is good in this hotel was the air conditioning! I would love to go back to rome but stay in better accommodation as i would proberly have enjoyed myself more!

Reviews.Title: “Being taken”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked and prepaid 2 rooms at the Caravel Hotel for 2 days in July 2005. When I got there I was directed to a totally different one 20 minuttes away in a run down part of town. In fact I was a victim of a shell game .I did not get what I paid for. So beware when booking with The Caravel hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Caravel”
Reviews.Author: BuckMcSchmuck
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the hotel. It was clean and simple, which was fine as we didn't spend much time in the room. There are no tea/coffee making facilities. The room had air con, satellite tv, a mini bar, and not much else. Our bathroom had a bath but the people we were staying with had a shower. The hotel is not centrally located, buses are required but one arrives every couple of minutes. The journey takes about 10 mins into the centre. One night we got off the bus at the stop after the hotel instead of the one before and ended up walking past some prostitues, just 5 mins away from the hotel :s Despite this we all felt very safe and the hotel is down a main road which does cause some evening traffic noises, but nothing too bad. The hotel staff are reasonably friendly and speak english very well. The breakfasts leave a lot to be desired. Literally all that is available is bread, cheese, meat, cereal, croissaints, egg and bacon. For the price we paid it is reasonable though, and we had a very enjoyable stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lying staff ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The actual hotel room was not too bad, a comfy enough bed, good sized bathroom - HORRIBLE breakfast. BUT BEWARE: THE HOTEL STAFF LIE AND WILL TRY AND RIP YOU OFF (just like almost EVERYONE in Rome!!) One very good tip which you must follow - NEVER order a taxi from the hotel staff, it will cost you at least 20euro extra yet they will tell you it won't. From this hotel to Rome Campino airport, it will ONLY cost you 25euro, NO MORE, do not believe them if they tell you it costs around 40-50euro- IT DOESN'T!!! Go outside the hotel and call a taxi off the street.

Reviews.Title: “good for a budget tour”
Reviews.Author: judyalt
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be a little further from the center of Rome than we would have liked, but public transportation is very close to the hotel and so the distance was not a problem. The rooms were clean, which was the most important factor. The meals were not bad and the staff was very helpful. The bar area in the lobby turned out to be a meeting place late at night for a lot of the people on the tour. You could get snacks in addition to drinks and the bartender was a very sweet man. A few doors up from the hotel is a restaurant that we ate in on our last night in Rome. Very good food. Also, internet access is available in the lobby. All in all, for the money and the type of tour we booked, this hotel was totally acceptable to us.

HotelInfo.Name: Caravel Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cristoforo Colombo 124/c, 00147 Rome, Italy
